properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for today. Snow squall activity has diminished considerably this morning for areas east of Lake Huron. As a result, the snow squall warning has been downgraded to a winter weather travel advisory. Additional snow squall activity is expected this afternoon. Brief periods of heavy snow are likely from time to time with an additional 5 cm or so likely. Hazardous travel conditions will be possible. Motorists are urged to exercise caution. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T03:28:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T15:30:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3905551734.2019
Area: Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for tonight into Saturday morning. Snow squall activity has greatly diminished off Georgian Bay this morning. However, additional snow squall activity is expected tonight into Saturday morning off Lake Huron as winds become southwesterly. Snowfall accumulations of 5 to 15 cm will be possible by later Saturday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T07:32:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T15:33:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1374925035.2019
Area: Bruce Peninsula - Sauble Beach - Tobermory
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls continue today. Local snow squalls will continue today. An additional 5 to 15 cm is possible before the snow squalls weaken later today. The worst conditions are expected to remain west of the city of Barrie and Highway 400. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T05:12:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T13:13:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2881249586.2019
Area: Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale, Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally intense snow squalls continue today. Snow squalls will continue through the day today, but are expected to slowly weaken with time. Additional snowfall accumulations in the 10 to 15 cm range will be possible, particularly in areas near the shores of Lake Huron. Storm total accumulations of 30 to 40 cm locally remain likely by the time the snow squalls weaken later today. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls continue today. Snow squalls are forecast to continue today, but are expected to slowly weaken with time. Strong winds may accompany these bands resulting in blowing snow at times. Total local snowfall accumulations of 25 to 35 cm will be possible by the time the snow squalls come to an end later today. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for today. Flurries and local snow squalls are forecast to continue this morning, but are expected to weaken with time. Locally heavy snow is expected along with reduced visibilities at times. Motorists are advised to watch for quickly changing weather conditions and adjust their driving accordingly. Total local accumulations of 5 to 15 cm will be possible by the time the snow squalls come to an end later today. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally intense snow squalls continue today. Snow squalls will continue through the day today, but are expected to slowly weaken with time. Additional snowfall accumulations in the 10 to 15 cm range will be possible, particularly in areas near the shores of Lake Huron. Storm total accumulations of 30 to 40 cm locally remain likely by the time the snow squalls weaken later today. The snow squall activity will move into western Lambton county this morning, but should remain east of the city of Sarnia. Travel along Highway 402 is expected to be very hazardous. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls slowly weakening today. Snow squall activity continues to affect portions of Lambton county close to Lake Huron late this morning. The activity is slowly weakening and should dissipate completely by late afternoon. Several additional centimetres are possible. Travel along portions of Highway 402 is likely to be hazardous. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls possible tonight into Saturday. Snow squalls are expected to develop off Georgian Bay tonight and persist into Saturday. Localized accumulations of 15 to 25 cm are possible by late Saturday afternoon. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls continue today. Snow squalls will continue through the day today, but are expected to slowly weaken with time. After significant snowfall accumulations last night, an additional 15 cm will be possible today over portions of the area, giving total accumulations of 25 to 50 cm. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 20 to 30 cm is expected. A Pacific front will move into northeastern BC this morning. This will be followed by an Arctic front pushing through the region later today and then stalling on Saturday. As a result, long periods of snow heavy at times are expected in the region. BC North Peace River - will see 25 cm of snow accumulation by midnight Saturday. BC South Peace River - can expect 25 to 30 cm of snow for northern sections including Chetwynd and Dawson Creek by midnight Saturday. Southern sections will receive 10 to 15 cm total. Fort Nelson - will see 20 to 25 cm of snow over southern sections including Sikanni Chief by midnight Saturday. The community of Fort Nelson will receive lesser amounts of near 10 cm total with this system. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T08:42:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T16:43:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1482735222.2019
Area: B.C. South Peace River, B.C. North Peace River, Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow still accumulating. Periods of snow will ease off this evening. Further snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are expected especially in the southeast. As this is the first significant snowfall of the season, the travelling public are urged to use caution and be prepared for winter driving conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T11:51:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T19:52:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2737438558.2019

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A series of low pressure systems moving in from the pacific will bring heavy snow to portions of northwestern Alberta beginning this morning and continuing through the weekend. Total snowfall accumulations may reach 30 to 40 cm by Sunday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T09:31:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T17:32:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2753970532.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wintry weather to spread south and eastward tonight. Colder air will turn rain into periods of snow this evening. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 centimetres are expected with higher amounts possible over higher terrain of the Annapolis Valley and northern Nova Scotia. As this will be the first significant snowfall across parts of the province, the travelling public are urged to use caution and prepare for winter driving conditions. In addition there is a possibility of black ice on some roads this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T11:20:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T19:21:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1226809998.2019
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Digby County, Cumberland County - Minas Shore, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County - Cobequid Bay, Colchester County North, Hants County, Colchester County - Truro and south, Pictou County, Antigonish County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for tonight into Saturday morning. Flurries and possible snow squalls are expected to develop off Lake Superior early this evening and persist into Saturday morning. Snowfall accumulations of 5 to 15 cm are possible. Hazardous traveling conditions are expected along Highway 17. Motorists are advised to watch for quickly changing weather conditions and adjust their driving accordingly. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T08:16:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T16:17:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1211888546.2019
Area: Marathon - Schreiber, White River - Dubreuilville, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong winds are expected to develop tonight as a low pressure system passes to the north. Winds are expected to weaken early Saturday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T09:35:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T17:36:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4051530322.2019

Park, M.D. of Pincher Creek near Pincher Creek and Twin Butte, Waterton Lakes Nat. Park and Blood Res. 148A
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A slow moving Pacific frontal system will continue to give rain to the North Coast. Rain over inland sections near Stewart will become heavier this morning and continue tonight. The rain is expected to taper to showers on Saturday afternoon as the front exits the region. Total rainfall amounts of 60 to 90 mm can be expected within a 48 hour period. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T10:37:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T18:38:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1230855384.2019
Area: North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Later this afternoon, cold arctic air moving over Great Slave Lake will create favourable conditions for snow squalls to develop. Snow squalls are likely to persist until Saturday morning. Local snowfall accumulations of 10 to 20 cm are possible. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T09:30:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T17:31:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2429292694.2019
Area: Ft. Resolution Region including Hwy. 6
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow will taper off to flurries this evening. Additional snowfall: near 5 cm. Locations: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Green Bay - White Bay, west of Grand Falls-Windsor and Buchans. Time span: continuing until late this evening. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-11-09T04:59:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T19:33:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2287884187.2019
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. Heavy snowfall will continue today in north central Alberta, and will begin this evening near the Edmonton Area. Heavy snowfall is expected to continue through Saturday. Total snowfall amounts of 20 cm is expected in western sections near Spruce Grove, Barrhead, and High Prairie, and 10 cm in eastern sections including Edmonton. Snow should taper off Sunday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-09T09:28:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-08T17:29:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0527825318.2019
